content:
Rabit under the
 tre 
 
 Phumy Zikode 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Rabit was sleping under an aple tre.
 An aple fel down from a branch.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A voice said, “Run rabit run!” 
 
 She woke up quickly and ran away with 
 great sped. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She met a chicken. “Why are you 
 runing?” asked the chicken. 
 
 Rabit replied, “I don’t know. I just heard
 something faling and a voice said, ‘Run
 rabit run!’” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The chicken was frightened. She started 
 runing when she heard what the rabit 
 
 said. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They met a dog. Dog asked, “Why are you
 
 runing?” 
 Chicken said, “I don’t know. I just heard
 what the rabit said, and she doesn’t
 
 know. She heard something faling and a
 voice said, ‘Run rabit run!’” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The dog was surprised about what she 
 heard. She started runing with Rabit 
 
 and Chicken. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They met a horse. The horse asked the
 
 dog, “Why are you runing?” 
 Dog said, “I don’t know. I just heard what
 the chicken said, and she doesn’t know.
 
 She heard what the rabit said and she
 doesn’t know. She heard something
 
 faling and a voice said, ‘Run rabit run!’”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The horse starts to run with the others. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They met a donkey. The donkey asked,
 
 “Why are you runing?” 
 Horse replied, “I don’t know. I just heard
 what the dog said, and he doesn’t know.
 
 He heard what the chicken said and she
 doesn’t know. She heard what the rabit
 said and she doesn’t know. She heard
 
 something faling and a voice said, ‘Run
 rabit run!’” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So Donkey starts runing to. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They met a cow. The cow asked, “Why
 
 are you runing?” 
 Donkey replied, “I don’t know. I just heard
 what the horse said, and she doesn’t
 
 know. She heard what the dog said and
 he doesn’t know. He heard what the
 chicken said and she doesn’t know. She
 
 heard what the rabit said and she
 doesn’t know. She heard something
 
 faling and a voice said, ‘Run rabit run!’”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The cow is woried and starts to run as 
 wel. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They met a cat. The cat asked, “Why are
 you runing?” 
 
 Cow replied, “I don’t know. I just heard
 what the donkey said, and he doesn’t
 know. He heard what the horse said and
 
 she doesn’t know. She heard what the
 dog said and he doesn’t know. He heard
 what the chicken said and she doesn’t
 
 know. She heard what the rabit said and
 she doesn’t know. She heard something
 
 faling and a voice said, ‘Run rabit run!’”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The cat started runing with the other 
 animals. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then they met the boy riding the bicycle
 and he asked, “Why are you runing?’
 
 And the animals replied, “We don’t know.
 We heard what the rabit said and she
 doesn’t know. She heard something
 
 faling and a voice said, ‘Run rabit run!’”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The boy laughed and said, “An aple fel 
 of the tre because of the wind. I’m the 
 
 one who said, ‘Run rabit run!’” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16
